organization.fullName: The First Hospital of Jilin University

identificationModule.briefTitle: Effect of Ginkgo Biloba Extract on Cognitive Function in Acute Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effect of Ginkgo Biloba Extract on Cognitive Function in Acute Ischemic Stroke: a Multicentre, Randomised, Open-label, Blinded-Endpoint Trial

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Associated Dean of the First Hospital of Jilin University
responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: The First Hospital of Jilin University

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to determine the effect of ginkgo biloba extract on cognitive function in acute ischemic stroke.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Vascular brain injury is a common post-stroke complication that can reduce cognitive function and lead to vascular cognitive impairment, placing a significant burden on families and society. The purpose of this study is to determine the effect of ginkgo biloba extract on cognitive function in acute ischemic stroke.

armGroups.label: The ginkgo biloba extract group
armGroups.description: Ginkgo biloba extract 8 pills three times per day is administrated.

interventions.name: Ginkgo Biloba Extract
interventions.description: Ginkgo biloba extract 8 pills three times per day is administrated.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Changes of the Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) score
primaryOutcomes.description: The MoCA scores in the 180 day of treatment minus baseline MoCA scores. MoCA scores range from 0 to 30, with higher MoCA scores indicating better cognitive function.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes of the Mini-Metal State Examination (MMSE) score
secondaryOutcomes.description: The MMSE scores in the 180 day of treatment minus baseline MMSE scores. MMSE scores range from 0 to 30, with higher MMSE scores indicating better cognitive function.
MoCA scores range from 0 to 30, with higher MoCA scores indicating better cognitive function.
MMSE scores range from 0 to 30, with higher MMSE scores indicating better cognitive function.
mRS Scores range from 0 to 6, with a higher mRS Score indicating a worse prognosis.

overallOfficials.name: Yi Yang, PhD
overallOfficials.affiliation: The First Hospital of Jilin University
